abstractContent.text: This paper briefly describes the KP-Miner system which is a system developed for the extraction of keyphrases from English and Arab-ic documents, irrespective of their nature.

entities.text: extraction of keyphrases from English and Arab-ic documents

abstractContent.text: The paper also outlines the performance of the system in the "Automatic Keyphrase Extraction from Scientific Articles" task which is part of SemEval-2.

entities.text: Keyphrase Extraction from Scientific Articles" task

introductionContent.text: )) is a system for the extraction of keyphrases from English and Arabic documents.

entities.text: extraction of keyphrases from English and Arabic documents

introductionContent.text: When developing the system, the goal was to build a general purpose keyphrase extraction system that can be easily configured by users based on their understanding of the documents from which keyphrases are to be extracted and without the need for any training documents or the use of any sophisticated natural language processing or linguistic tools.
As such, the keyphrase extraction process in KP-Miner is an un-supervised one.
When building a general purpose keyphrase extraction system, this was an important objective, as training data is not always readily available for any type of data.
The goal of entering the KP-Miner system into the SemEval-2 competition, was to see how well it will perform on a specific task, without making any changes in its default parameters.

tableCaptions.text: Table 1: Performance of all participating systems over  combined keywords when extracting 15 keyphrases
Table 2: Performance over combined keywords when  extracting, 5, 10, and 15 keyphrases
Table 3: Performance over reader assigned keywords  when extracting, 5, 10, and 15 keyphrases
